com.sap.conn.jco.ext

Interface PasswordChangeHandler


  • public interface PasswordChangeHandler
    This interface allows the implementation of a handler that prompts the user for setting a new password, which is then used for changing a user's password in the connected SAP back-end system. This is useful if a Java program offers user interaction through some UI (User Interface), and the password for the designated user ID in the SAP back-end is supposed to be changed before further working with this user ID. For example, this might be the case if the password is still initial, has expired, or a password does not fit anymore to more strict password rules which have been defined by the back-end's administrator and therefore a password change is required now. In such a case JCo will invoke the promptPassword(...) method of the registered password change handler.
    If no such password change handler is present, and the SAP back-end system allows to work with an initial password, the destination configuration property jco.client.deny_initial_password is evaluated whether the processing shall continue normally or an exception shall be thrown by the JCo runtime instead.

    Note: A successfully changed password in a SAP back-end system does not mean that the new password would automatically be used by the JCo runtime. If this shall be achieved, the PasswordChangeHandler must also notify the registered DestinationDataProvider which on its turn then must change the password in the relevant managed destination properties as well. Furthermore the Java application has to fetch a new JCoDestination instance from JCoDestinationManager.getDestination(<destinationName>) with containing the new password afterwards in order to work with the new logon parameters.

    See Also:
    Environment#registerPasswordChangeHandler, Environment#removePasswordChangeHandler, DestinationDataProvider#JCO_DENY_INITIAL_PASSWORD

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void passwordChanged(JCoDestination destination, String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      This method will be invoked after the PasswordChangeHandler triggered a successful password change at the SAP system back-end side.
      String[] promptPassword(JCoDestination destination, Exception previousException)
      This method will be invoked if a password is recognized as initial or expired and hence needs an update.

    • Method Detail

      • promptPassword

        String[] promptPassword(JCoDestination destination,
                        Exception previousException)
        This method will be invoked if a password is recognized as initial or expired and hence needs an update. It is called repeatedly as long as the desired password change failed and the underlying RFC connection is not broken and still valid. The process of changing a password can simply be aborted by returning null or an empty password string.
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination for which the password of its configured user shall be changed
        previousException - null on the first invocation of a password change process, otherwise an exception which describes why the last password change attempt for the destination's user failed
        Returns:
        String[] with array element 0 containing the old password, and element 1 the new password; if null is returned, or if an array element is null or an empty string, the password change will be cancelled

      • passwordChanged

        default void passwordChanged(JCoDestination destination,
                             String oldPassword,
                             String newPassword)
        This method will be invoked after the PasswordChangeHandler triggered a successful password change at the SAP system back-end side. The invocation of this method always follows a call to method promptPassword(...) after the password change finally succeeded. The given passwords are those which were returned from the preceding promptPassword(...) invocation.
        Note: The implementation of this method is the best place for notifying a DestinationDataProvider about a changed password, so that it can update its managed destination configuration properties as well.
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination for which the password of its configured user was changed
        oldPassword - the old password before the change
        newPassword - the new and current password after the change
        Since:
        JCo 3.1.7
